Organism_Record.Function_Summary: Zinc phosphodiesterase, which displays some tRNA 3'-processing endonuclease activity. Probably involved in tRNA maturation, by removing a 3'-trailer from precursor tRNA.
Organism_Record.Catalytic_Mechanism: Endonucleolytic cleavage of RNA, removing extra 3' nucleotides from tRNA precursor, generating 3' termini of tRNAs. A 3'-hydroxy group is left at the tRNA terminus and a 5'-phosphoryl group is left at the trailer molecule.

Funtion.Detail: Catalysis of the hydrolysis of various bonds, e.g. C-O, C-N, C-C, phosphoric anhydride bonds, etc. Hydrolase is the systematic name for any enzyme of EC class 3.
Catalysis of the hydrolysis of ester linkages within nucleic acids.
Catalysis of the hydrolysis of ester linkages within nucleic acids by creating internal breaks.
Interacting selectively and non-covalently with any metal ion.
Catalysis of the hydrolysis of ester linkages within ribonucleic acids by creating internal breaks to yield 5'-phosphomonoesters.

BioProcess.Detail: The process in which a pre-tRNA molecule is converted to a mature tRNA, ready for addition of an aminoacyl group.
Cleavage of the 3'-end of the pre-tRNA as part of the process of generating the mature 3'-end of the tRNA; may involve endonucleolytic or exonucleolytic cleavage, or both.

PDB.PDB_Title: Crystal Structure of RNAse Z/tRNA(Thr) complex
PDB.PubMed_Title: Structure of the ubiquitous 3' processing enzyme RNase Z bound to transfer RNA.
PDB.Author: Li de la Sierra-Gallay, I., et al.

PDB.PubMed_Title: Structural basis for substrate binding, cleavage and allostery in the tRNA maturase RNase Z.
PDB.Author: de la Sierra-Gallay, I.L., et al.
